metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2825 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Firefox before 47.0 allows remote attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy and modify the location.host property via an invalid data: URL.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2825` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
